review_preview: This is only the second Thai restaurant in Madrid I have been to. We came here because of the good reviews and the high ranking in tripadvisor. The interior of the restaurant is fancy, similar to many other bars and restaurants in this part of...
review_full: This is only the second Thai restaurant in Madrid I have been to. We came here because of the good reviews and the high ranking in tripadvisor. The interior of the restaurant is fancy, similar to many other bars and restaurants in this part of the city. What it lacks is a feel of authenticity. We got seated on one of the two large tables to be shared with other guests (we arrived without reservation and this was the last space they had available). We ordered Tom ka kai, Som tam tai and Kaeng khiew wan kai. The first disappointment about the salad was that they did not have green papaya and instead offered to make it with green mango, which the waiter said didn't make much of a difference. Unfortunately, the mango turned out too soft and sweet, which ruined the salad for me. The soup was unbalanced and too sweet, and had too much onion. The green curry was not exciting, I was missing basil and lime leaves, it also contained carrots, peppers and zuchini which were misplaced to my taste. The waiters were friendly, although they could have been more attentive. The kitchen was very slow. I was much happier eating at Thai orchid, which is also in the area. It may not be as fancy but the quality of the food is much higher. It is also cheaper.

title_review: Wonderful meal in our last night in Madrid!
review_preview: Two friends and I turned up at Bambubox on a Thursday evening at around 8pm. We walked for 15 minutes before finding the place down a quiet side street off the Gran Via in a really unassuming location. The restaurant itself is really beautifully designed...
review_full: Two friends and I turned up at Bambubox on a Thursday evening at around 8pm. We walked for 15 minutes before finding the place down a quiet side street off the Gran Via in a really unassuming location. The restaurant itself is really beautifully designed inside, however, with great lighting, modern decor, and a really lovely atmosphere with some softly playing classical music.  My friends weren't great lovers of Thai food and/or were pretty inexperienced with it, but I'm so glad we came to Bambubox and tried it out. In terms of food: I ordered some vegetables rolls that came with a sweet chilli and peanut dipping sauce to start, and one friend ordered a sort of curry soup - both were delicious and really simple, with great flavour. For a main course, we all ordered a chicken variation of Pad Thai, and when my friends asked for no oyster sauce both the chef and waitress were really accommodating to their request. For desert I ordered the mango sticky rice in the hope that it would be as delicious as the authentic dish I'd had in Thailand earlier that year, and my friend ordered the tapioca pudding. Though she was a little disappointed with hers - thinking it lacked any outstanding flavour - mine was really delicious. The portion sizes for each meal were really well thought out, and were wonderfully authentic with modern twists (e.g. the presentation), and the many available dishes on the menu all sounded delicious.  The staff were really attentive to our requests throughout the evening, and spoke great English when our poor Spanish failed us. They helped us to order a taxi when we asked, and gave a great description of the dishes on the menu when we asked for some guidance. Overall, a great meal with a lovely atmosphere and a perfectly peaceful end to our week trip in Madrid!

title_review: Stayed one night in Madrid just to eat here!!!
review_preview: May I say this is the most amazing restaurant I have ever had the pleasure to eat in. On the outside it is not fancy at all, and the restaurant is literally in a basement, the decor is very typical of Madrid wood ceilings and...
review_full: May I say this is the most amazing restaurant I have ever had the pleasure to eat in. On the outside it is not fancy at all, and the restaurant is literally in a basement, the decor is very typical of Madrid wood ceilings and pictures of the owner with all the celebrities that have dined here. Very minimum decor. The service is superb!! The owner himself "Angelito" goes from table to table asking you if everything is fine. We ordered Huevos estrellados as an appetizer and the Solomillo as an entree. It was the best steak I had ever had!!! The Jamon Serrano is exquisite and the bread with tomatoes amazing. At the end we were too full for dessert so Angelito decided we shouldn't leave without trying the variety pastelitos and sent us a platter free of charge! May I say I am so glad he did because they were so delicious.  I liked that it is not packed with tourist, on the contrary, this is were the madrile√±os dine. This has got to be the best restaurant I have ever stepped foot into! Will go here every time I visit Madrid.

title_review: You certainly won't have trouble being indulgent here....
review_preview: Amazing!  I know it‚Äôs a little over the top, but the food here is to die for.  It is true that the restaurant is a little hard to find, but hey, the goods in life don't come easily.  The restaurant is very traditional, as others...
review_full: Amazing! I know it‚Äôs a little over the top, but the food here is to die for. It is true that the restaurant is a little hard to find, but hey, the goods in life don't come easily. The restaurant is very traditional, as others have alluded to, with the decor not very modern and the walls covered with pictures of all the stars that have visited (a bit tacky), but it adds to the whole experience. For me, however, I like that in a restaurant as it builds a sense of a unique character and special ownership. Obviously, the above is nothing without fabulous food. So let me begin with the perfectly sliced ¬´jamon iberico¬ª (ham). I absolutely adore this, it was perfect. It was coupled with the most fabulous tomatoes I have ever tasted (which were lightly salted with some olive oil). I could have died happy at that moment. Alas, I had to eat on. The next course followed with a sizzling, perfectly cooked steak. It obviously came on a hot plate, which was good for those who wanted to cook their steak a little more ‚Äì as the steak was very rare. For me it was perfect. Coupled with some Churrasco, I was set and a little salad if I remember correctly. Be honest, I can't remember the rest, as I had died and gone to food heaven. I need to thank my friend again, who now lives in Madrid, for this magical experience. I will never forget it and I certainly know the first place I will go to when I next land in Madrid...

review_preview: Family members recommended Bambubox and I'm so glad they did - as a lover of Thai cuisine, this certainly didn't disappoint!The restaurant is just off Gran Via and is so easy to find ‚Äì the restaurant name is on the front windows and from...
review_full: Family members recommended Bambubox and I'm so glad they did - as a lover of Thai cuisine, this certainly didn't disappoint! The restaurant is just off Gran Via and is so easy to find ‚Äì the restaurant name is on the front windows and from the exterior, the restaurant looks inviting. Once inside, the decor is incredibly modern, with a blend of simplicity and Oriental features. Origami lotus flowers adorn every table and the main feature is the bamboo ‚Äòpalm tree‚Äô in the middle of the restaurant, which extends to the ceiling. We began with the Bambubox starter platter, which consisted of their most popular starters, with accompanying dips. There were five gorgeous little morsels to try and I quickly dug into the first: a steamed dumpling, filled with minced pork and vegetables. I‚Äôm a big fan of dim sum, so quickly followed it up with the chicken and vegetable pastry dumpling, which had that gorgeous coconutty ‚ÄòThai‚Äô flavour. The spring roll was light and stuffed with crunchy vegetables ‚Äì and went so well with the chilli dipping sauce. I loved the chicken satay too, but the highlight had to be the centrepiece: a cold raw papaya salad, topped with peanuts.  We then all chose a main course each, with the intention of having sampling a little bit of everything. Each main course comes with a portion of sticky rice, but there are also other types of rice (and noodle dishes) available. Luckily, everyone picked different dishes, with everyone except me choosing curries. My uncle picked the Kaeng Ped Yang: a red duck curry with vegetables, which was fairly mild in comparison to other red curries I‚Äôd had before. It was also quite sweet, which I enjoyed. My auntie opted for the Kaeng Khiew Wan Kai: a hotter green curry, packed with chunky pieces of chicken and vegetables. My mum chose her favourite Thai curry, the Masamam Nua: a beef massaman, with potatoes and cashew nuts. I was late to trying that one, but the beef was beautifully cooked, so soft. I decided on the Kapao Talay: stir-fried seafood with basil and pepper. Unlike the curries, there was no thick or creamy sauce and instead the herbs and spices provided all the flavour. There was a decent mixture of coated fish and seafood (including king prawns, squid and mussels) and it was all cooked to perfection.  I‚Äôll finish by complimenting the service. I think there were two waiting staff and just one person in the kitchen, but everything was efficient and our server was so lovely ‚Äì and passionate about his job. After hearing so many good things from my family and reading reviews online, I‚Äôm so glad Bambubox lived up to expectations and I know I‚Äôll definitely return.

title_review: Get the Cheese cake! Get the Cheese cake! Get the Cheese cake!
review_preview: In case I didn't mention it before, GET THE CHEESE CAKE! I'm a foodie. I live for food. I've had hundreds of slices of cheese cake and this was the best by far. Perfect texture, perfect level of creaminess.... I'd go again just for the...
review_full: In case I didn't mention it before, GET THE CHEESE CAKE! I'm a foodie. I live for food. I've had hundreds of slices of cheese cake and this was the best by far. Perfect texture, perfect level of creaminess.... I'd go again just for the cheese cake.  Everything else was also really good. I had the Argentina style beef and my fiancee had the Iberico ham. Both were superbly cooked and were delicious. The starter was a squid dish which wasn't really my style, but I put that down to personal preference. My fiancee loved it.  Also, the best staff we had in all of Spain. The manager was very attentive, but not overbearing. The menu is only in Spanish, but he took great care to translate it for us and answer any questions. 10 out of 10. Would definitely go again. And again, and again. ps. If you book a table through Tripadvisor it may be possible to get 30% discount.

review_preview: I came here with my husband for our last night in Madrid. We are from the US. We have been sick of eating tapas and wanted something different. We found Bambubox on TripAdvisor based on reviews. When we first walked in and sat down, we...
review_full: I came here with my husband for our last night in Madrid. We are from the US. We have been sick of eating tapas and wanted something different. We found Bambubox on TripAdvisor based on reviews. When we first walked in and sat down, we thought the place was very nicely decorated. It was a Tuesday night and there were only 2 waitstaff, which seems enough since there were only 6 tables occupied. The waiter was nice and took our order in English. We ordered their Bambubox appetizer (an assortment with 2 pieces of appetizer and their mango salad), Pad See Yew, Green Curry and 3 glasses of their house white wine. The food and wine was soooooo delicious. We especially love their Pad See Yew. The best we ever had and we probably tried all the Thai restaurants in New York. Thanks for a great last meal in Madrid!

review_full: We were looking for a non-touristy restaurant with real Spanish food and that's what we found at El Lando. We arrived around 10 pm on a Friday and the place was packed with a sophisticated local crowd. Even though the staff spoke little English they were very welcoming and the service was terrific. Everything was delicious but standouts were the tomato salad, heavenly grilled asparagus, and berberechos. There's nothing gimmicky here, just impeccably fresh food, prepared exquisitely, in a charming atmosphere. It was the one memorable meal we had in Madrid.

review_preview: I travel to Madrid once or twice a year, and have done so for the last three years.This restaurant is my favorite in Madrid. While Madrid has several locations to get good local cuisine, if you are looking for a great dining experience these...
review_full: I travel to Madrid once or twice a year, and have done so for the last three years. This restaurant is my favorite in Madrid. While Madrid has several locations to get good local cuisine, if you are looking for a great dining experience these are hard to come by. France and Italy have many; Madrid only a few. Tres Bocas is one of my favorites. You should know, however, that Tres Bocas is run by Argentinians... but it does have a Spanish flare. I have been to Tres Bocas 4 or 5 times and had several of their dishes. I have never been disappointed. The service is attentive, and the wait staff are amongst the friendliest you will encounter.

review_preview: I celebrated a business dinner with 15 pax during the month of May 2019. The location is the very well known Club Allard, a neoclassical building from beginning of the XXth century at the very center of Madrid. The main salon is decorated in a...
review_full: I celebrated a business dinner with 15 pax during the month of May 2019. The location is the very well known Club Allard, a neoclassical building from beginning of the XXth century at the very center of Madrid. The main salon is decorated in a classical and stylish manner, perfect for business meetings. The food (Menu is changed every 3-4 months) was absolutely impressive from beginning till the end. Original dishes with colour and taste presented with style and creativity.  As for the service, they were discreet and professional. I was a bit scared about the English skills (noting some complaints of previous guests), but a couple of them were able to serve in correct English. The only slightly negative point was concerning the wines. They were not indicated on the menu and we were not informed about them when I asked before and after the dinner. So we don't know what we drunk! :)

review_preview: This was my first experience at a Michelin stared restaurant and it certainly did not disappoint.  I ordered the smaller of the two tasting menus - only 10 courses instead of 14 - and the wine pairing of 8 glasses of wind (this was a...
review_full: This was my first experience at a Michelin stared restaurant and it certainly did not disappoint. I ordered the smaller of the two tasting menus - only 10 courses instead of 14 - and the wine pairing of 8 glasses of wind (this was a concern since I normally drink 2 glasses and on special occasions 3).  As each course was served it was explained by the waiter who was wonderful about any questions I might have and then the wine was explained by the Director of Food and Beverages - all the wines were from Spain. The food was beautifully prepared, unique, tasty and the wines well suited. (I do like wine and have a palate which allows me to observe the unique bouquets and essences of various wines) I was quite pleased with all of the selections. As would be expected, the evening was not for the light of wallet costing a total of appx. $300 for the evening for 1. That said the experience was definitely worth it and I'd recommend it for anyone who can make it to this wonderful restaurant.

review_preview: This restaurant is clearly Foodie Heaven.  We ate ala carte from a menu clearly designed for a high/low tasting menu experience. Why? well... the protein choice included in the tasting menu was simply described as "Loin" which we found out was "Horse".  Sorry, not going...
review_full: This restaurant is clearly Foodie Heaven. We ate ala carte from a menu clearly designed for a high/low tasting menu experience. Why? well... the protein choice included in the tasting menu was simply described as "Loin" which we found out was "Horse". Sorry, not going there. I had the suckling pig, which was fine and my partner had pigeon which she loved. Everything was slightly strange, in a good way. My labeling this experience as eccentric is due to the music sound track in this elegant expensive space which was based on the Bee Gees and the Eagles etc which was jarring. Also, given the prominence of this restaurant in a world class capital city, they did not have a waiter who spoke English. This was no major obstacle to enjoying the evening, but it was a bit of a struggle.

review_preview: 'Twas after the promising first course that it all went down hill.The second course arrived, ensconced in a glass kettle emanating stream of co2, arousing high expectations that this little genie once released from its bottle would grant all our culinary wishes. This particular...
review_full: 'Twas after the promising first course that it all went down hill. The second course arrived, ensconced in a glass kettle emanating stream of co2, arousing high expectations that this little genie once released from its bottle would grant all our culinary wishes. This particular genie's name was baby lobster head baked in a squid inked bun. Unfortunately it appears our genies were not baby lobsters, but lobster abortions trapped for weeks in their dry, black, bread bun prisons and had resorted to emanating a strong fishy stink as a call for help. From there on, it was just one disappointing fish dish after the other. Whilst the presentation was commendable, the execution was far from satisfactory - the fish being more like something slimy & textureless that you'd slurp at a yum cha than expect to be plated up at a Michelin 2-star. Just when we thought we'd escape from the stagnant fish tank, then 'sea rice' turns up. Not really sure how to describe this, other than green cochineal coloured fish-stock flavoured thickened rice. It just doesn't work. But wait - there was yet more fish to come. My partner booked our table months ago & advised staff she was 'pescatarian'. It would seem they interpreted this as 'pescadorian' as after ALL that fish, all the supposedly talented 2-star chefs could dredge up for the crowning glory of the dinner - the main - was yet MORE fish, this time a pan-fried slice of turbot with vegetables so salty as to be barely edible, reminiscent of what might be served on a business class flight on some sub-par Russian government operated airline.  By this time we were in hysterics, and me down $100 on losing the bet that they wouldn't dare bring another fish course out - and expressing thus to our poor waiter, who was clearly aware of our high levels of fish discomfort. So in closing, this will be a memorable night and the source of many very inappropriate 'fish' jokes - and all because of the food.

title_review: A beautiful meal worthy of the Michelin stars
review_preview: We always book a splurge meal for each trip and decided on Club Allard for our Spain vacation. My husband is not into anything too avant-garde so that narrowed down some choices. A draw for me is chef Maria Marte. She is not only the...
review_full: We always book a splurge meal for each trip and decided on Club Allard for our Spain vacation. My husband is not into anything too avant-garde so that narrowed down some choices. A draw for me is chef Maria Marte. She is not only the only female chef in Madrid with any Michelin stars but her story of starting off as an immigrant dish washer and now worked her way up to the head chef is awesome.  The restaurant is very close to Plaza Espana and the royal palace. You enter a building in the corner and it doesn't seem quite like a restaurant from the entry. The dining room is light in color, tons of space between the tables for privacy. It's certainly a posh place and I recommend a jacket for the men.  There are 2 choices for the tasting meals, a shorter 10 course "Rendezvous" and a longer 14 course "Seduction". We opted for the later. The wine list was also extensive and to be honest really reasonable priced for this caliber of restaurant. We saw a lot of bottles priced around 50 euros, and I don't think I saw any quadruple digits (at least not in the Spain section anyways). Our waiter helped us pick up 2 bottles of Spanish red that are less well known but were both fantastic. Ended up being cheaper than getting the wine pairings. Ok now the courses: Starters: - Smoked Eel with Coconut - My husband usually does not like eel and he loved this dish. The eel is very light in flavor here but the smokiness and coconut flavors paired well. - Red King Prawn Bombon - Looks like a Godiva truffle but even prettier. Interesting but slightly fishy for us. - Shot of Butter Fish and White Asparagus - Wow, I was expecting fishy because it's well a shot of fish, but the flavors were awesome, lots of umami. - Quail Egg and Truffle Cupcake - The playful "classroom" theme started here. I made the mistake of biting the cupcake in half and dripped the delicious filling all over, what a waste! Haha. - Norway Lobster - Man oh man, this was by far the best bite of shrimp/lobster/crawfish spectrum of shellfish I've ever had. Just incredibly tender. I could make a whole dinner out of this for sure. Best bite of the night! - Comte Cheese Soup - A nice soup, was just ok relative to rest of the menu. - "Sea Rice" - A painstakingly chopped up piece of calamari made to resemble a line of rice, lots of sea flavors. - Venison with Chen-Chen Sand - Probably my least favorite of the meal, the venison was somehow on the mealy side for me. Main dishes: - Baked Turbot - Excellently cooked piece of fish with sauces of seasonable veggies on the side. - Wagyu Picanha - Super tender beef and a very rich and flavorful sauce. Desserts: - Hibiscus Flower and Pisco Sour - Almost too pretty to eat! Tasted just like pisco sour. - Cheese in 2 textures - Less memorable of the desserts - Creamed chocolate - A couple different consistencies in this plate made it interesting. - "Blackboard" - The signature ending here. A bunch of sugar candy things that you can actually write on the board with and eat. Fun! During the dessert course, they brought us an extra big board of sweets to eat with our fingers because it was our anniversary celebration. Really awesome! Overall, we had a fantastic meal here with fabulous food and wine. The service was also top notch. While not every single bite was WOW, there were many that were very memorable. If each bite was sensational, then I would expect 3 stars, but to be honest, I haven't had that at 3 star establishments either. But we certainly appreciate the excellent cooking and a good amount of creativity. And for the caliber of the food? I think the price is a steal compared to the US restaurants!

review_full: We booked 2 Michelin-starred restaurants for our Madrid trip and we all agreed that El Club Allard is better than the other one. We had lunch here with the short menu - which already made us so very full! The wine recommendation was super, the menu was right for the hot summer time. Service was remarkable and the way food was served was fun and flawless.  It appears to be quite a popular place for business lunch and people keep bumping to each other! The building itself is also a beautiful one. The restaurant is on the ground floor but the lift is beautiful which you may want to have a ride! It is a must go place for their food, service and the experience!

review_preview: .......and still may be the most beautiful dining room in Madrid although unfortunately downgraded this year from two MStars to one M Star. Well - we have eaten in quite worse two M Stars and for sure there are one M Stats restaurants in Madrid...
review_full: .......and still may be the most beautiful dining room in Madrid although unfortunately downgraded this year from two MStars to one M Star. Well - we have eaten in quite worse two M Stars and for sure there are one M Stats restaurants in Madrid that do not catch up with Club Allard. To start with the sommelier Alvaro , he is still one of the leading sommeliers in the spanish capital. Curiosity and profound knowledge sometimes even of the visited vineyard itself is just fabulous. Staff in general very friendly and always helpful. They make you feel that you are here to enjoy yourself. Winepairing this time as Alvaro always surprises us. What a joy. Thank you for showing the world that spanish white wines can be a fabulous option for a world class menu. Solo 2.016 from Lebrija outstanding. And of course food in Club Allard is still worldclass and climbing up the MStar ladder is always possible. Lets start with making more variety of bread. One class of bread is not enough. Mar and Monta√±a snacks-surf and turf -very nice. Oyster Amelie with white butter icecream a delicate bite. Wildmushroom infusion and slow cooked egg nice but be advised that a little bit too much of that palo cortado ( sherry alike) might ruin the delicate flavour of the mushrooms. Turbot excellent but may be still a little bit too common. A certain ‚Äúsomething‚Äù is needed. May be the hirezake? Yes -but we did not like it. We would have preferred a good sake without the fishbone emulsion. The cook was working on Tokyos Ginza before.....ok we understand. The suckling pig was one of the best ones we ever ate. Desserts very good but may be a little bit more fantasy on the patissiers side would be needed.  All in all a great food and of course wine experience.

review_preview: This restaurant is a bit har to find- it it located up half a flight of marble stairs inside a building that requires one to buzz in. But, the food and wine make this worth the effort. The setting is quiet and elegant, a bit...
review_full: This restaurant is a bit har to find- it it located up half a flight of marble stairs inside a building that requires one to buzz in. But, the food and wine make this worth the effort. The setting is quiet and elegant, a bit old fashioned. We began with a set of six amuse bouches, each a delightful one-bite treat. The procession of courses was well-orchestrated and the flavors and balance of each course was excellent. The last savory course, guinea fowl, tasted very good, but it seemed rather plain compared to all of the preceding. courses. Our two desserts were preceded by an offering of four cheeses, selected by the restaurant. The wine list has a wide range of options, at various price levels. The food came out with in 10 mins and everything was delicious! Easily the best food and service we have had in Madrid! We ordered a little more after those dishes: grilled squid and also a pork dish! Honestly we have been traveling in Spain for three weeks and no restaurant has even come Close to the experience we had here! This place should not be missed if you are in Madrid!

The lady (didn't catch her name, seemed like the owner) spoke perfect English (not sure where she is from!) which was helpful as our Spanish is a bit touch and go! She brought all the diners out a small taster from the kitchen which was a nice touch and it was absolutely delicious! We decided to go for the prawns & garlic, the quiche, the jamon plate and the goats cheese salad - all of which were amazing, especially the quiche! We also had a lovely bottle of Alberino wine (my new fave!) and purely 'for digestive purposes' the lady gave us a couple of shots of Limoncello on the house to finish off!  All in all a really great place, great staff and amazing food at really reasonable prices. Don't hesitate, just go!

title_review: Cuisine and service are king here

But with this comment out of the way - I have to say this is one of the most fantastic dinners I have enjoyed in a while! It is very inventive cuisine served imaginatively and unusually - and the flavours ands ingredients are amazing. We opted for the gourmet menu with pairing wines. The sommelier was totally charming and extremely enthusiastic and offering a full and informative description of every wine. The wines were a perfect match too for every course and there were a lot of them! All the wines were Spanish and some were local from Madrid. It was a memorable experience to be taken through to the chefs table - meet the chef and be guided through a couple of dishes by an enthusiastic and charming sous chef. Other dishes are prepared at the table by different chefs. A simply wonderful experience.

title_review: New chef, new menu and new price
review_preview: This was probably our 5th or 6th visit to El Club Allard in the past 4 years. We were huge fans of the cuisine by Chef Maria Marte. Unfortunately, she is no longer at helm of the restaurant. The service is still excellent, however we...
review_full: This was probably our 5th or 6th visit to El Club Allard in the past 4 years. We were huge fans of the cuisine by Chef Maria Marte. Unfortunately, she is no longer at helm of the restaurant.  The service is still excellent, however we thought that menu price was higher than before (last time we were there was in October 2017).  You can now choose a la carte menu or choose one of the 2 tasting menus at ‚Ç¨115 or ‚Ç¨145. We chose the one for ‚Ç¨115 and we believe the food we had does not justify the price we paid.  Some dishes were disappointing. Mainly the Cresta de Gallo (rooster comb) which our opinion was tasteless. I love tasting exotic / unusual food as long as they are tasty. This was not the case. Another disappointing dish was Coca de Atun (tiny pieces of raw tuna) which had a very fishy unpleasant taste. The tuna had a "compota de tomate" which tasted just like a watery apple juice. One of the Sous chefs comes to the table to finish the dish and explain it. I know many will be impressed by this presentation, but the dish itself was very disappointing. We loved the Pechuga de pichon. Outstanding! The foie gras and goat cheese was very tasty. In summary, in our humble opinion, El Club Allard is no longer outstanding. The tasting menu price is for a 2-star Michelin star restaurant, but food we had was not worth of a 2-star Michelin restaurant.

review_preview: We visited on March 1, 2016, as this was one of the restaurants in the top 25 best restaurants in the world, as voted by TripAdvisor travelers, for that year.  We did not go to Madrid because of it, however it is worth a return...
review_full: We visited on March 1, 2016, as this was one of the restaurants in the top 25 best restaurants in the world, as voted by TripAdvisor travelers, for that year. We did not go to Madrid because of it, however it is worth a return trip to see what new dishes they have come up with since then. Sadly, we did not see this restaurant listed on this year's top 25, which is a shame. The building does not give away the treasure it hides inside. There are no huge neon signs to let you know that you have arrived. There is a gold plaque with the club's name, once you go inside. I love this air of secret exclusivity a lot. This restaurant is by reservation only (or was in 2016) and I booked way in advance to avoid disappointment.  You can choose from a couple of set menus or go a la carte. We both opted for Menu Revolucion and were not disappointed. The decor, ambiance and food screamed elegance and class. The food was incredible and service impeccable. We had a couple of business cards with El Club Allard propped up on glass holders set and waiting for us at the table. They turned out to be edible (and delicious), whether dipped in the sauce that was brought over right away, or not.  The many plates that kept on coming were gorgeous and bearing tiny pieces of delicious food art. At first glance, one may think that they will not satiate one's hunger, but that could not be further from the truth. We left with eyes and bellies full! The restaurant itself has an air of exclusivity and made us feel like royalty. Everything was tasteful and elegant and our very expensive lunch was worth every penny! This meal, along with our dinner at Funky Gourmet in Athens, has been one of our most memorable (late) Valentine's meals. Would highly recommend you treat yourself to the experience! Word of warning: When the sommelier came over to take our wine order he asked if we prefer red or white. We responded that we love either and would like his recommendation on which one to have with the dishes from the Revolucion menu. He said he knows the perfect Spanish white to accompany some of the courses and a great Spanish red for the remainder. We said we'd go with what he suggested, expecting a glass of white and a glass of red each to sip on with the various courses. What we did not expect was that we had inadvertently agreed to a bottle of each. We are no big drinkers, but the wines were every bit as delicious as expected, even at 45 euro per bottle.  I believe we took 4 hours to finish our lunch (and wines!) and even though we were the last ones to leave, at no point were we made to feel unwelcome or rushed. Love Club El Allard and would highly recommend it to anyone!

The sommelier is knowledgeable and picks unusual wines (like the one from Canary Islands). They give you the menu and wine pairing in print when you leave (even when you have made changes to the set menu), so you can read up on wines or dishes when you get home.  All in all an outstanding experience.

review_preview: I never of tire of Spain, particularly its food. We had spent the previous 8 days enjoying its bounty. Madrid was the last leg of the trip, a late switch of plans to take in the football. The least I could do was to take...
review_full: I never of tire of Spain, particularly its food. We had spent the previous 8 days enjoying its bounty. Madrid was the last leg of the trip, a late switch of plans to take in the football. The least I could do was to take Mrs MM for a sumptuous dinner. It was a steamy evening towards the end of August when we dined at El Club Allard. We'd made an effort, all dressed up & somewhere to go. The taxi dropped us at the wrong end of the street, never mind, a few minutes later we were out of the heat & being warmly greeted. We were seated, offered an aperitif, whilst they were attending to the drinks, we were offered both the menu & the wine list. We opted for the 10 course tasting menu to be accompanied by an excellent bottle of Rioja. The plus points were the standard of service, the staff were polite & engaging, the dinner room was spacious,the tables weren't too close together. The dining was full there was a hum to the room. The negative, the food, whilst cooked and presented properly it lacked a certain je ne sans quoi, I found it dull and uninspiring. Normally, Mrs MM is more expressive than me, the odd umm & ahh gives you a hint all is well, but nothing. I'm sure it was a world tour, a fusion so to speak but I did not get it. We're not rookies at this sort of thing and we have had the odd let down, unfortunately this was one of them.

review_preview: I went there with my work team for our Christmas celebration. We arrived with very high expectations given the superb reviews here in TripAdvisor (N¬∫ 1 restaurant in Madrid) and by the fact that Club Allard had just won their second Michelin star recently, and...
review_full: I went there with my work team for our Christmas celebration. We arrived with very high expectations given the superb reviews here in TripAdvisor (N¬∫ 1 restaurant in Madrid) and by the fact that Club Allard had just won their second Michelin star recently, and happily, my expectations were completely exceeded.  The atmosphere is elegant and refined, yet at the same time relaxed, probably by the very nice and warm treat of all the personnel. They made us feel like we were at some friend's house, which really makes a difference in such an exclusive place. And then the food... each plate was delicious and amazingly surprising with the mixture of flavours and textures. The chef managed to create a completely new feeling and taste on dishes, which after thinking it over, were probably inspired on rather classic tasteful treats. Like their best know dish which is basically a fried egg with bacon and toast!  The menu is closed to three options, which I would resume as: smaller, classic and novelty and that rank from 75 to 95 eur. We went for the novelty menu which included three starters, three main dishes and three desserts. Their wine list is extensive but mainly focus on Spanish wines. We spend the whole night talking about the dishes and the amazing feelings they produced on each of us. Arguing about what kind of ingredient we were looking or tasting and wondering how they managed to ‚Äútransform‚Äù a mushroom into an algae or a ‚Äúchurro‚Äù into a coral. And then the final surprise was the last dessert: ‚ÄúThe egg‚Äù. I won‚Äôt ruin the surprise of telling what it really was, but it was absolutely amazing. Attached I‚Äôm only including the pictures of the desserts: The ‚Äúflowerpot‚Äù, the ‚Äúfishbowl‚Äù and the ‚Äúegg‚Äù. If want to indulge into a little dinning-luxury while on Madrid, this is the place to go.

review_preview: I never had a dining experience like it. You rarely get the chance to drop 85 euros per person and have so much fun doing so. Too often, high-end restaurants mean paying for overly expensive locales, paintings, etc. The Club Allard is nice enough, classical...
review_full: I never had a dining experience like it. You rarely get the chance to drop 85 euros per person and have so much fun doing so. Too often, high-end restaurants mean paying for overly expensive locales, paintings, etc. The Club Allard is nice enough, classical decor, etc, but you're here for the food, not to see a Rembrandt. And what a treat it was! The rascally-looking chef came out personally and spent a few minutes chit chatting and asking us about things we like. He even spoke to my dinner guests in English. He used that to come up with an 8-course meal that was outstanding. The textures, combinations, colors, variety were all well balanced. The portions made just right, to eat every bite and look forward to the next. OK, by course #6 we were getting really full, but there was no way I was going to stop! Some of the dishes were aesthetically sophisticated and beautifully served, and others were, well, delightful and made us guffaw and laugh and eating them was so much fun! You have to eat there to understand it, really. I've never had this kind of dining experience before. All three of us were so happy we had dinner there. The waiters were efficient and helpful, the wines were perfectly suited (we asked the steward to recommend). I'm dying to go back.

review_preview: El Club Allard is an overwhelmingly excellent experience; every part of the evening is innovative, exciting and inspiring. This is a mix of technical culinary skill, excellent staff and elegant location which sets the bar very, very high. Diego Guerrero is clearly a man of...
review_full: El Club Allard is an overwhelmingly excellent experience; every part of the evening is innovative, exciting and inspiring. This is a mix of technical culinary skill, excellent staff and elegant location which sets the bar very, very high. Diego Guerrero is clearly a man of great culinary understanding, he is not a brash celebrity chef but comes across as a man who is genuinely interested in his art and strives for perfection. His dishes are challenging, interesting and totally enjoyable - he takes convention and "toys" with it, fooling the eye and tongue by creating things which looks conventional but are far from it. Despite this style the food is not aloof, pretentious or inaccessible; it is entertaining, fascinating and makes the diner question just how the creations arriving from the kitchen came to be. As a diner it is like being a child again being lead by Guerrero to discover new tastes and textures ‚Äì the faces of the other diners in the restaurant are a theatre of expressions of surprise and delight as firstly the dishes arrive and secondly as they are consumed. This is no ordinary place by any measure. Having no menu is certainly an intriguing model; Guerrero comes to each table to introduce himself, to ask how many courses and to ask if there are any allergies or dislikes; from then on it is an illuminating process of being lead through a voyage of constant surprise, discovery and delight. This is not a self-indulgent process of molecular gastronomy collecting diverse tastes and textures for the sake of TV celebrity, these are accessible dishes created with absolute dexterity designed to please rather than to raise eyebrows. Clearly an experience such as this does not come cheap but neither should it ‚Äì Guerrero has clearly invested time, money, passion and intellect into this restaurant but when you compare what it costs in Madrid to what it would cost in London then this is truly an absolute ‚Äúmust‚Äù for anyone who is interested and inspired by the work of a culinary artist such as Guerrero. It is not for everyone but it is for anyone who purports to enjoy an evening of culinary discovery.

review_preview: There is no menu. You choose the number of courses you want and the chef decides what you get. However he consults with you personally beforehand for allergies and dislikes. We are fairly fussy but confined our dislikes to 3 areas and were quite lucky...
review_full: There is no menu. You choose the number of courses you want and the chef decides what you get. However he consults with you personally beforehand for allergies and dislikes. We are fairly fussy but confined our dislikes to 3 areas and were quite lucky with the outcome. We loved everything from the friendly efficient service to the breads and linens and of course the food. There is an extensive and expensive wine list but we had a wondeful Spanish blend (mainly shiraz) for around ‚Ç¨30. The food was varied, well presented and delicious. We went with the smallest number of courses (we are middled aged with small appetites!) and left feeling well satisfied without being overly full with lots of overly rich food. Our half portions of main fish and meat courses were adequate for us. I noticed that the chef seemed to spend most of his time in front of house which means he must have a gret team in the back! The personalised menu of what you had received, including choice of wine, was a nice touch. Would definitely return and wholeheartedly recommend.

review_preview: This restaurant is not that kind of place you would return at home and tell your friends "We casually found a wonderful restaurant". It doesn't have any sign outside, you must enter a wonderful modernist palace and ask for the Club Allard. Inside, you'll find...
review_full: This restaurant is not that kind of place you would return at home and tell your friends "We casually found a wonderful restaurant". It doesn't have any sign outside, you must enter a wonderful modernist palace and ask for the Club Allard. Inside, you'll find the real creative soul of Madrid, with funny, stunning and modern dishes which will fullfill your eyes before your mouth. If you are going to Madrid looking for touristic menus, megameals and frozen paella, then you can miss this restaurant. But if you want to experience why spanish kitchen is considered the avangarde of modern food, then book a table here, in this elegant temple of food culture. It won't be cheap, but it will be unforgettable.

title_review: Outstanding, and one for serious foodies..!
review_preview: This restaurant deserves its many accolades. Chef Diego Guerrero focuses directly on his customers. He spoke to our table before and after the meal. We took one of the degustation menus that showcased his most popular servings. It was exceptional. Chef Guerrero moves towards molecular...
review_full: This restaurant deserves its many accolades. Chef Diego Guerrero focuses directly on his customers. He spoke to our table before and after the meal. We took one of the degustation menus that showcased his most popular servings. It was exceptional. Chef Guerrero moves towards molecular gastronomy but without Heston's theatre and supporting paraphanalia. This is all about the food rather than the journey. But there are still surprises and lots of cleverness. After two and a half weeks travelling through Spain and enjoying some good, bad and indifferent tapas we decided to finish our holiday at one of the best restauants and top end food Madrid could offer. This we achieved by dining at this restaurant. Highly recommended, and suggest if you are serious about food, don't leave Madrid without dining here. Also, interestingly, it is nowhere near as expensive as its equivalents in London. Although it is a little hard to find as it doesn't have a sign on the outside of the building. You have to walk into the foyer, up a few stairs and find the door on the right, opposite the lift. But it is certainly worth the effort to find it.

review_full: We visited El Sur last Friday, having arrived in Madrid from Morocco a few hours earlier. It was probably early by the local standard (6:30ish), and the place was still empty. Our waiter, Alex, turned out to have spent some time in our home state NJ so we all had a nice chat. We ordered the recommended dishes (with asterisks next to them): garlic shrimps, flank steak, grilled squids, Spanish tortilla, patatas brava, and a creamy tomato soup. Not too crazy about the patatas brava, would have preferred fried potatoes rather than boiled, or the white sangria (a bit sweet for my taste, but my daughter liked it.) Other than that, the soup was very good and all other dishes were excellent, especially the steak and garlic shrimps. The red wine was pretty decent too. The price of our dinner was surprisingly cheap. This place is definitely worth a visit if you are in Madrid: good foods, very friendly services and quite cheap.

title_review: Whether its tapas or raciones or salads, Taberna el Sur is Madrid's best.
review_preview: Taberna el Sur is our favorite Madrid restaurant.  Against all personal precedent, we ate there a second time during our visit to Madrid, and it was partially because of Jasmine & Alex that we did so.  They are welcoming and most helpful and delightful; they...
review_full: Taberna el Sur is our favorite Madrid restaurant. Against all personal precedent, we ate there a second time during our visit to Madrid, and it was partially because of Jasmine & Alex that we did so. They are welcoming and most helpful and delightful; they and the other staff give the restaurant a level of warmth & comfort that surpasses anything else that we found in Spain. Jasmine and Alex both speak excellent English and will guide you through el Sur's varied and very reasonable menu choices. None of this would matter if the food were not also excellent, but it is. The tapas and raciones were the best that we found in Spain. We had two different very tasty salads, Cuban style shredded beef, gambones, musaka, and several other very good dishes, as well as good tintos, blancos, and cavas, and scrumptious homemade desserts (especially the carrot cake). With Taberna el Sur you get delicious food, excellent value, and Jasmine & Alex.

review_preview: El Club Allard was one of three 2 star Michelin restaurants we had the pleasure of visiting in Madrid. Situated in a corner historic building you pass through the lobby with security guard and are escorted to your table. The restaurant consists of several rooms...
review_full: El Club Allard was one of three 2 star Michelin restaurants we had the pleasure of visiting in Madrid. Situated in a corner historic building you pass through the lobby with security guard and are escorted to your table. The restaurant consists of several rooms with high ceilings and simple decor. There is a choice of menus and we opted for the ten course priced at 115 Euros. Interesting courses well described with three small appetizers, "Sea Rice" - actually squid made to look like rice and very clever, duck, fish, beef and three desserts. An extremely high level of workmanship prevailed all through the menu which was nicely balanced. Staff were all very friendly and mostly spoke good English and the sommelier was highly interactive when she found out we were in the wine trade. The wine list is excellent and for Spanish wines very good value for money and we had a bottle of the fabulous Belondrade y Lurton Vedelho. A lovely dining experience and we would certainly recommend El Club Allard.

title_review: Great food, superb staff and lovely environment
review_preview: Went to Club Allard for my wife's birthday as part of a 5 day trip to Madrid. This was the culinary highlight! The 2 Michelin stars are fully deserved and the 10 course tasting menu was full of great cooking and some surprises - a...
review_full: Went to Club Allard for my wife's birthday as part of a 5 day trip to Madrid. This was the culinary highlight! The 2 Michelin stars are fully deserved and the 10 course tasting menu was full of great cooking and some surprises - a cup cake that turns out to be a savoury with a quails egg inside; a dish that seemed to be rice but was actually made of finely cut squid. The advice about wine was excellent. Service was exemplary, helpful and engaging. The price was what you would expect from a Michelin rated restaurant. Pricey, yes but absolutely value-for-money. This was a great place to celebrate and experience superb food and service.

review_preview: El Club Allard is one of those restaurants where you cherish every bite as your palate is tantalised with a depth of flavours and textures.  The dishes are creative, wholesome, yet familiar, and presented in an aesthetically pleasing manner, with some dishes like a piece...
review_full: El Club Allard is one of those restaurants where you cherish every bite as your palate is tantalised with a depth of flavours and textures. The dishes are creative, wholesome, yet familiar, and presented in an aesthetically pleasing manner, with some dishes like a piece of art on a plate. Though we had trouble finding the entrance, as there is no sign outside the building or on the wrought iron gates, once inside it is elegant, peaceful and calm. There are two tasting menus. We had the 12 course tasting menu which I was a little bit ambiguous about thinking my palate would get very muddied, however, I have to say that at the end of the meal, I was totally sated though I did not feel like a total gourmand. Nothing was overpowering. Everything was perfection. The dishes are too many to go into detail, though one of my favourites was the Shot of Butter Fish and White Asparagus foam (looked like a miniature beer) served in a shot glass accompanied with a seaweed toast with fish and oil roe. Another standout for me was the Quail Egg and Truffle Cupcake, to be eaten in one mouthful as once you bite into the cupcake the quail egg overflows into your mouth. The Hibiscus Flower and Pisco Sour pre-dessert bite was another artful presentation with the candied hibiscus flower sitting on a bed of pistachio cookie crumbs topped with a pisco sour foam, a great entrance to the dessert dishes.  El club Allard certainly warrants it‚Äôs two Michelin stars. The restaurant is not overly pretentious, with the wait staff being attentive, efficient, and genuine, and all had a good understanding of English. It is an expensive restaurant (115 to 145euro) but worth every penny for your palate to be aroused. I am filled with inspiration to be more artful when I entertain at home, though the sumptuousness of tonight's food cannot be replicated.

review_preview: Noted chef Maria Marte runs a tight ship in the kitchen and the dining room.  Our tasting menu seemed endless, which was a good thing, because each course was so beautifully presented and delicious, even when we were full we did not want it to...
review_full: Noted chef Maria Marte runs a tight ship in the kitchen and the dining room. Our tasting menu seemed endless, which was a good thing, because each course was so beautifully presented and delicious, even when we were full we did not want it to stop. This included perhaps the most helpful wine steward in Spain. He came to talk with us about foods and wines we liked and then made a selection for us that was wonderful (and we were pleased to find when the bill arrived was also a bargain). Our waiter was wonderful and attentive without being at all intrusive. We did manage to crack his professional demeanor when he asked how we like the incredibly complex and exquisite ell soup. "It's exactly like my mother makes." Even he had to chuckle at that. We've enjoyed meals at other 2-star Michelin restaurants, but this one is just perfect. At once, both a finely honed machine, and eager to adjust to each individual diner. Really heavenly.

title_review: It¬¥s all about the food and this restaurant is FAB!
review_preview: Perfect location next to the Gardens of Plaza de Espana (which is a nice stroll afterwards and before for all the romantics).  Really welcoming and very unpretentious (well as unpretentious as one can be in a Michelin Star Restaurant whilst being served 15 courses:)).........but really...
review_full: Perfect location next to the Gardens of Plaza de Espana (which is a nice stroll afterwards and before for all the romantics). Really welcoming and very unpretentious (well as unpretentious as one can be in a Michelin Star Restaurant whilst being served 15 courses:)).........but really relaxed atmosphere. The chef, Diego Guerrero visits every table to discuss the dishes and take your order (Great touch and very personal, also came back at the end to ask our opinion of the food and to say goodbye). The food was fantastic, different influences from all continents but with a clean, well structured sabor theme throughout all the courses. Drama, Comedy, Complexity, Fun!! The food had everything and the ingredients were fresh as fresh can be, and very well matched. Staff were very relaxed and even the smart young waitress was remarkably well schooled in the courses (unlike the bored school leavers that one can sometimes get in other restauraunts). All in all a great evening and very reasonably priced (IMHO) for the quality and everything else above.. BTW I took the Gastonomique Menu, but everybody was happy with other choices (BTW this was, Saturday night and the restaurant was full so book in advance).

title_review: Terrible value, dire atmosphere. Avoid at all costs.
review_preview: We decided to give this place a try after reading Trip Advisor reviews and because we fancied a change from tapas for our evening meal. On our arrival shortly after 9pm, we were told that as we'd didn't have a reservation, we'd have to be...
review_full: We decided to give this place a try after reading Trip Advisor reviews and because we fancied a change from tapas for our evening meal. On our arrival shortly after 9pm, we were told that as we'd didn't have a reservation, we'd have to be seated at the corner of a large table: no problem. The restaurant itself was not busy, only three or four tables were occupied, mainly by tourists and several of their reservations we later discovered turned out to be 'no shows.' Possibly a sign of what was to come. Somewhat bizarrely, the ambience was nil: most tables remained empty throughout our visit and by the time we left an hour or so later. Perhaps potential diners were driven away by the awful Kenny G-style covers of ballads including 'My Heart Will Go On', entirely at odds with the style of cuisine on offer. Our drinks order was taken fairly promptly by a friendly waiter: unfortunately the menu had been amended and Estrella was no longer available, it had been replaced by Stella Artois. Not an issue, as we were advised about a decent Spanish alternative, which we ordered. After ordering a spring roll starter, shrimp and papaya salad and green chicken curry, the waiter returned to apologise: the kitchen was out of green papaya, would mango do instead? No problem at all. Except that when the infamous salad did arrive, it consisted of a pile of shredded mango, a handful of chillies and precisely two small shrimps. Not the greatest value for ‚Ç¨10.50 per plate. We politely queried this with the waitress who responded defensively and rudely by claiming that plating up is the kitchen's responsibility and 'it's not my fault I just work here' before walking away with no attempt to resolve the situation. At this stage, not a single bite had been eaten and we seriously considered paying for the beers and walking out, except for the sudden arrival of all the other dishes simultaneously; curry, rice and our starter of four small, flaccid spring rolls.  Fortunately the kinder waiter (and sole member of staff with an an ounce of customer service training, it seemed), came over to apologise and to ask if we wanted to replace the salad with another alternative. We did, and chose a chicken fried rice. This finally arrived towards the end of our meal after chasing, (and yet more rudeness from the worst waitress in Madrid). Having travelled extensively around Thailand, we can say that the food at Bambubox is, on the surface at least, authentic. The menu choices certainly reflect Thai dishes and ingredients, when the advertised ingredients are available. However, value for money here is poor: small portions and clearly scrimping when it comes to more expensive ingredients. Although the food tasted good, it was unforgettable and certainly captured little of the flair for delicious Thai cooking. Customer service at this establishment also leaves little to be desired. Avoid if you can, there are many other preferable choices for Asian cuisine in Madrid.

title_review: Must try once in life time
review_preview: We visited this restaurant 2 years ago and were pressed with the creativity and design of the chef Diego Guerrero. Originally, we did not have plan to visit Madrid. We had some spare time and decided to visit Madrid again. So, we did not make...
review_full: We visited this restaurant 2 years ago and were pressed with the creativity and design of the chef Diego Guerrero.  Originally, we did not have plan to visit Madrid. We had some spare time and decided to visit Madrid again. So, we did not make reservation at all. Fortunately, there was a table available for us.  Same as last time, Diego was still on his Crocs and came out to take the order by himself. We ordered the tasting menu. It costed EUR 74 and offered 2 snacks, 3 starters, 2 fish course, 1 meat course, 1 pre-dessert, 2 desert and Tea/Coffee + Petit Fours. The price is the same as 2 years ago.  The dishes were mainly on gastronomy styles. For example, it looks like a tomato but it is not a real tomato. It is tomato concentrate in membrane.  There was a disk offered Squid with fungus in Squid Ink. Very creative combination. The taste of fungus in octopus ink was incredebility good.  Another fish dish is also very good. I cannot remember the fish is hake or monk fish. The fish skin is very crunchy but the fish texture is smooth & fresh. It formed the contrast of texture. At the same time, I can feel the real fish taste itself not the seasoning. Compared to Arzak (we visited a few days before this one), it is much better. Arzak's fish was just like a chewing gum without fish taste itself but just the taste of seasoning.  The desert is the most fantastic part. The award winning fish bowl came first. It really looked like a real fish tank. Everything inside was eatable and delicious. The 2nd desert was an egg. After breaking the egg shell, it had egg white and egg yolk inside. The egg yolk was in liquid status. See photo. The taste was brilliant. We were very satisfactory with this dinner. The cost performance ratio is exceptionally remarkable. It is only a 1-starred restuarant. We think that it is far better than some 3-starred restuarants.

title_review: You will be sorry that you don't give this place a try. It is the very best!
review_preview: After much research online, I decided to booked El Club Allard to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday in Madrid. Being his 30th birthday and organizing a trip to Europe to celebrate, I wanted to be certain that our dinner is going to be memorable and...
review_full: After much research online, I decided to booked El Club Allard to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday in Madrid. Being his 30th birthday and organizing a trip to Europe to celebrate, I wanted to be certain that our dinner is going to be memorable and exquisite! El Club Allard did not disappoint! Making a booking was easy enough, I just had to send a couple of emails and that's it. I mentioned in my reservation that it was for a 30th and they did a little something special with the dessert for my boyfriend which was a nice touch. From the moment we walked into the restaurant it just felt lovely. Everyone was really nice and the attention to details and the way they make one feel was amazing. We didn't opt for the pairing of wines with our selection but we did opt for the Gastronomic degustation menu and it was amazing. Head chef, Diego Guerrero came out and greeted us and asked whether we have any dietary requirements moments after we got there. The sommelier was great as well. He offered two great wines for us to go with our dinner and they were fantastic. Overall, the food was amazing. Each dish that comes out gets better and better. It was beautiful to look at, almost like a master piece and best of all, the taste was amazing. It was both visually appealing and tantalizing to the taste bud. It was actually sad when our last dish arrived! Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Madrid. The price was excellent and valued for money for what they served there and it is definitely a great experience to dine at this beautiful restaurant. The ambiance was great and the service was very professional and just right. I don't know whether it's because they knew we were celebrating a special occasion and that we were visiting Madrid, we were given a pair of beautifully and nicely printed menu with the date of our dinner to take home with us. It was a lovely touch and a great way to end our dining experience at El Club Allard! I can't wait to be back there with my boyfriend again! It is definitely one of the best place in the world!

From the moment we walked in until the moment we left they treated us like royalty. Now the food. Inventive, creative, tasty goodness. We both loved every course and the waiter(s) explained everything in Spanglish. Also, it says a lot about the integrity of a waiter when you ask for a Wine recommendation and he recommends something mid price range. The Wine? So smooth and paired well with every dish. I have to talk about the dessert because I am not a dessert guy. I don't really have a sweet tooth but I had to dive into the aquarium they put in front of me just out of curiosity. The different textures and not overly sweet. The kicker was the special plate they brought out for my Wife's Birthday. For the experience we had the bill was not that bad. I've paid much more for less. Go here if you are adventurous and you love great food along with perfect service.

title_review: Authentic and delicious. Give it a try!
review_preview: Hello everyone!We like to try the restaurants that bring to life that authentic spirit of the place we are visiting, and this little nice place did just that.The service was prompt and the people were helpful and friendly. We chitchat about our countries,...
review_full: Hello everyone! We like to try the restaurants that bring to life that authentic spirit of the place we are visiting, and this little nice place did just that. The service was prompt and the people were helpful and friendly. We chitchat about our countries, made jokes, enjoyed ourselves. And this is before the food arrived. We were indeed very hungry, but all dishes were indeed very good, very tasty. We had the mousaka and spinach with cheese tapas, fried squid, fried shrimps and ropa vieja, a dish with meat pulled from the bone. A chardonay for the seafood and a dry red wine completed the experience. Although I have more places I want to try in Madrid, I am already thinking of revisiting Taverna El Sur.

title_review: A heavenly experience -fabulous as in "out of this world" food, special atmosphere, best service!
review_preview: I arrived a bit skeptical as I had to give my Credit card info ahead of time, etc.. Also, and modesty aside, I have been fortunate to  have eaten at numerous Michelin starred restaurants (Fat Duck, PerSe, French Laundry, Waterside Inn, La Gavroche, Bagatelle, Moulin...
review_full: I arrived a bit skeptical as I had to give my Credit card info ahead of time, etc.. Also, and modesty aside, I have been fortunate to have eaten at numerous Michelin starred restaurants (Fat Duck, PerSe, French Laundry, Waterside Inn, La Gavroche, Bagatelle, Moulin de Mougins.. and many more) and to be honest felt that I was finished with 'testing menus', etc. I booked because my daughter has turned into a "foodie' (specially when Mom pays!) and wanted to try it. I don't want to get carried away with superlatives but truly: we LOVED this meal! We had the 10-course menu and they were all fabulous. Not a weak one in the bunch! The service was exceptional .. flawless. We wanted to try Spanish wines and were expertly advised! When I thought the evening could not get any better, the Chef Maria Marte came to our table. As impressed as I had been with the meal, I was floored with Ms. Marte - not only is she a world class chef, she is a unique and inspiring human being. Her story - starting as a dish washer at the restaurant to being awarded two Michelin stars brought tears of joy and pride! I considered my evening at El Club Allard among my most memorable ones! Can't wait to return!

title_review: Food Quality Varied, Service with Attitude
review_preview: We ordered the 10-course menu as we're not big eater, esp when we're not used to late dining (restaurant opened at 9 pm).  One-third of the courses were outstanding, including the 1st two & one of the main courses, which was pork.  The rest were...
review_full: We ordered the 10-course menu as we're not big eater, esp when we're not used to late dining (restaurant opened at 9 pm). One-third of the courses were outstanding, including the 1st two & one of the main courses, which was pork. The rest were average, & one course, which was the featured "cupcake" was a disaster. The crust was way too thick, which adversely affected the overall taste. Service was extremely cool, to the extent of having an attitude. That started when I declined the offer to have my coat hanged. I have not brought my handbag, and my pockets were filled with varies stuff. I'd really preferred to keep it at the back of my chair. Then, my husband had the 4-glass wine-pairing. The Sommelier said wine-pairing was tailored according to individual preference. My husband specifically said he did not want dessert wine. She acknowledged and said she'd bring white, red, & maybe some sparkling wine. We had no idea she did not understand. When she brought the 4th glass, which was dessert wine, of course my husband declined. At the end of the dinner, we're charged for all 4 glasses for ‚Ç¨40. When we inquired, the waiter simply said the Sommelier's English's not good without any apology. Yes, some courses were exceptional, but unfortunately that did not warrant us to recommend this restaurant.

title_review: As compulsory as the Prado in Madrid
review_preview: Its seems the Spanish have it right in being able to marry haute cuisine and tasty food. This impression was shared by everybody at my table of Le Club Allard (nothing french here, the owner of the building took off the G and o of...
review_full: Its seems the Spanish have it right in being able to marry haute cuisine and tasty food. This impression was shared by everybody at my table of Le Club Allard (nothing french here, the owner of the building took off the G and o of the original Gallardo to make it sounds french). There are 3 set menus at 74, 84 and 94 euros. The more you pay, more food you have. We decided for the 84 which was enough. We also tooke the sommelier‚Äôs recommandation of having 4 different wines with the food, 2 whites, 2 reds. Anywhere else in the world in that kind of restaurant you would end up in paying a hefty price for the wine. Here, the very kind and knowledgeable somelier, make us discover unknown and exceptional local varietals at a surprinsingly 5 euros a glass.    We were served throughout the diner may be 12 dishes, very creative. Mind and palate were equally spoiled.   Negative note, the lighting make the place a bit depressing. If you are only 2, ask to be seated near the bar, it is more romantic.    It was such a great experience to eat here.

review_preview: We decided to revisit this restaurant as it has been awarded a 2nd Michelin star and still is number 1 on Tripadvisor. And we were not disappointed. You do not have a cart to choose from, only 3 different menus with varied quantity of dishes....
review_full: We decided to revisit this restaurant as it has been awarded a 2nd Michelin star and still is number 1 on Tripadvisor. And we were not disappointed. You do not have a cart to choose from, only 3 different menus with varied quantity of dishes. The idea is that they will give you whatever fish or meet they have fresh for the day. So you do not know what you are getting, but you can always ask for some "classic" signature dishes and you may get them. We were overwhelmed by the quality, taste and invention of Chef Diego Guerrero and the service was excellent too. Try the "fish bowl" for desert, it is amazing. Highly recommended.

review_preview: On a recent trip to Madrid, I was invited to dinner here.  It was your classic old school place that seemed to be steeped in tradition. The type of place where you can tell some of the waiters had been there for years and took...
review_full: On a recent trip to Madrid, I was invited to dinner here. It was your classic old school place that seemed to be steeped in tradition. The type of place where you can tell some of the waiters had been there for years and took pride in what they did. Seconds after sitting down there was a plate of thinly sliced tomatoes and a plate of Jamon Iberico. So far, so good. A bottle of the house wine came and then the dinner just started getting better and better. We ordered a plate of french fries with eggs (I think they are called patatas revueltos or something like that) and they were fantastic. I ordered the monk fish (rape) and it was prepared simply and was very delicious. At my table someone had gambas al ajillo and someone else had the entrec√¥te - both incredible as well. The dinner was wrapped up with desert (we ordered a custard) and I am happy to say that the meal was great. A bit on the pricey side but you get what you paid for. The place seems to be a magnet for celebrities as the walls had a lot of photos of famous people eating there. The night we were there, the president of Colombia was sitting at the table right next to ours. I would happily go back on my next trip to Madrid.

The menu is simple, the food is outstanding, the service extraordinary and nothing has changed in 15 years even the servers are the same which gives it a very familiar feeling. Angel the owner and his son Angelito are both very welcoming and are always making sure everything is to your complete satisfaction. If you come to Madrid don't leave without visiting El Land√≥

review_full: About 10 minutes walk from the Prado, this is a small place, but on a Thursday in January we (2 of us) were told no reservation was necessary. That proved to be true, at least for a 6:00 pm dinner. We had the mediterranean salad, which had olives and oranges and balsamic and was delicious. And of course the paella: flavorful saffron rice, mussels, clams, fish, octopus (tender!), and crayfish. So tasty! title_review: Lovely starters but mains were not!
review_preview: After all the reviews we thought we would try this place out for dinner after work. We have all travelled through Asia and Thai food is my favourite.The service was very efficient and friendly. The mixed starters were really good.But then the mains...
review_full: After all the reviews we thought we would try this place out for dinner after work. We have all travelled through Asia and Thai food is my favourite. The service was very efficient and friendly. The mixed starters were really good. But then the mains arrived....the salmon was cold when it arrived so they took it back and warmed it up quick enough. The beef massaman had what looked like roast potatoes in it and was swimming in oil. The green curry was very salty, no spice and had virtually no authentic ingredients..no thai aubergines, pea aubergines or peppers. Only bamboo slices, runner beans and carrots! The beef salad was actually quite nice but not your typical beef salad....no green papaya etc...more like a garden salad with thai sauce and chunks of beef! Such a shame after those starters.

title_review: The Best Japanese Restaurant in Madrid. And beyond.
review_preview: Reliable, consistent, delicious, great food and top notch service. There are two locations in Madrid, with the one on Castellana being our favorite. The one in Flor de Baja is just as good, same menu, great attention to service and food quality, but parking near...
review_full: Reliable, consistent, delicious, great food and top notch service. There are two locations in Madrid, with the one on Castellana being our favorite. The one in Flor de Baja is just as good, same menu, great attention to service and food quality, but parking near this location is very tricky, so for the same experience, if you're driving, go to the Castellana 45 location. Sushi is exceptional, tempuras are delicate, meat dishes are wonderful, and the presentation of all dishes is beautiful. Desserts are definitely a treat here - and a perfect end to a great meal, every time. Make the time to eat here :-)

review_preview: Our first entr√©e, salmon roe and scallops (incredibly tender), was so perfect that I jokingly said to my partner: "It will be all down hill from now on".  But no, the same top quality was maintained throughout the meal, which consisted of Tuna Tartare, "Meatballs"...
review_full: Our first entr√©e, salmon roe and scallops (incredibly tender), was so perfect that I jokingly said to my partner: "It will be all down hill from now on". But no, the same top quality was maintained throughout the meal, which consisted of Tuna Tartare, "Meatballs" of Cantabrian Octopus (indefinable and original taste, delicious), 3 Nigiris: Toro, Eel and Salmon Roe, Baked Black Cod (melted in the mouth) 3 Temakis: Spicy Tuna, Crab and Eel, sweets, two bottles of water and a bottle of Ros√© Cava. Bill 124‚Ç¨. Expensive but worth it. Service was extraordinarily good. Discreet but very attentive. Sparkling wine was served in small quantities, so it stayed cool in the glass, but the glass was always replenished just before it was empty. Patient and friendly explanations of the menu. We never felt hurried, the food arrived with excellent timing, so that we never rushed our meal, but neither were we ever waiting (two and a half hours from start to finish; where did the time go?). The service was the ideal complement to the food and turned the evening into a real occasion. Will definitely return.

title_review: I don't "prefer" Japanese but this was above expectations!
review_preview: I am the typical person who doesn't "prefer" Japanese cuisine but who goes only if her friends go. Well, Myama made me change my mind on many things! We had the Bento box, accompanied by California rolls and Green tea noodles, the latter one was...
review_full: I am the typical person who doesn't "prefer" Japanese cuisine but who goes only if her friends go. Well, Myama made me change my mind on many things! We had the Bento box, accompanied by California rolls and Green tea noodles, the latter one was the highlight of the dinner! Presentation is amazing and the food is fresh and of high level. We shared several things so eventually we managed to get away with 40 euros per person. Not the cheapest sushi to have in town but definitely a great option if your aim is to impress your guest or date!

title_review: Disgusting people working at the restaraunt - be warned
review_preview: Worst service I have seen in my entire existence. We were a family of 5 (with two small children who were below the ages of 8). We booked for 10:15pm, but got stuck far from Madrid as we missed a train, our phones were dead...
review_full: Worst service I have seen in my entire existence. We were a family of 5 (with two small children who were below the ages of 8).  We booked for 10:15pm, but got stuck far from Madrid as we missed a train, our phones were dead and we rushed as much as possible. Unfortunately we arrived at 10:50 pm but had no phone to tell the restaraunt that we were running late.  We came and explained what happened and the lady at the front said sorry it's too late, we're busy. We asked if they could at least try considering we came all the way and had hungry kids, the manager came told another waiter to tell us they were busy. We saw a table empty and asked why we couldn't sit there, they said " we'll give you two options, either you order take away or you leave, we are busy and don't have time for this".  Lazy, rude and careless for a hungry family who drove all the way with a booking. Shocking, horrible, and disgusting. Be warned and do not visit this in humane establishment. Shame on the managers and the employees.. the rudest and most disrespectful staff I've ever seen. We regret reserving and driving all the way there to deal with such disgusting people.

We were not disappointed! The atmosphere of the restaurant is cozy and inviting. From the moment we walked in, Miguel, Frank, and Rebeca were incredibly welcoming and friendly. My sister is a vegetarian and they were very accommodating about answering all our questions about the menu. I ended up getting the seafood paella and my sister ordered a dish with egg, mushrooms, and potatoes in a delicious sauce. Even though the portions were extremely generous, we still finished every bite. For the freshness of the food, the prices were amazing too. This was by far the best meal we‚Äôve had in Spain. Our only regret is that we don‚Äôt have time to eat here again before we leave.

review_full: Many 2 or 3 star Michelin restaurants fail to live up to the hype. Allard exceeds expectations and should be up for a third star. Fine dining should be serious, but also fun, there needs to be an Oh Wow factor. Allard has that and then some. I won't give away chef Diego Guerrero's secrets, but many courses are illusion, they are not what they seem, and when the recognition comes of what you are actually eating, many people, myself included, laugh out loud, and literally go Oh Wow.  This is destination dining. A unique experience. It should be on top of any foodie's visit to Madrid. Chef Guerrero's greets his customers, and stops by afterwards. You are in good hands throughout the experience. Don't miss this.
