I did see on here before we went similar comments but decided to keep my booking as it was somewhere I wanted to try. I fell ill after course number 4 and couldn't face any further courses, however my husband did finish his! The staff were very attentive especially when I felt ill. The wine list was extensive and the wine we ordered was very good.  Overall decent enough place and staff,food average but wouldn't rush back.

review_preview: El Club Allard is a must for a memorable meal while in Madrid! The decor is along the lines of more traditional fine dining. Large spacious dining room with white table clothes and plenty of space between guests. When we arrived it was quite empty...
review_full: El Club Allard is a must for a memorable meal while in Madrid! The decor is along the lines of more traditional fine dining. Large spacious dining room with white table clothes and plenty of space between guests. When we arrived it was quite empty so the space seemed a bit sterile, but as the dining room filled up the ambience was much better. The wait staff was excellent. They always made sure our glasses were full and were very knowledgable about the wines and menu. All of the dishes were creative and delicious. I will say that the ones that stood out were the foie gras and truffle starter, the Turbot main and the desserts. The courses were well paced and the chef even came out to the dining room a couple times during our meal to see how his guests were doing. I think this says a lot about the chef and the restaurant in going above and beyond to make sure that the guests are well taken care of - it also gave us a chance to tell him how excellent his food was! This was by far our best meal in Madrid.

I was a bit worried but I'm not a wine expert so I couldn't choose from their extensive menu. The Chef came out to meet us himself before and after the meal. He was very personable too.  And the cost of the meal was just right. It was a real treat, something we planned long before our trip but I'd say we were very satisfied.

review_preview: This was the best meal of my life. I have read all of the superlatives listed in other reviews and while I would normally restrain myself, this restaurant really does live up to it's billing.We had lunch and every single dish was perfect. It...
review_full: This was the best meal of my life. I have read all of the superlatives listed in other reviews and while I would normally restrain myself, this restaurant really does live up to it's billing. We had lunch and every single dish was perfect. It is very unusual in such a long tasting menu not to have a single wrong note but it was all exquisite. So often, Michelin starred meals trade taste for inventiveness or shock value but the tastes here were perfectly balanced. What was most impressive, however, was the value for money. Wines were very reasonably priced and the sommelier made suggestions which were delicious but well priced. Nice touch of the chef to both welcome us and say goodbye before we left. I just cannot recommend Club El Allard highly enough.

review_preview: This restaurant is just fabulous, I can't explain this enough without you attending yourself! It is located in the corner of a very grand apartment block, there is a doorman though so you can find it ok. Inside the decoration is plain, simple but extremely...
review_full: This restaurant is just fabulous, I can't explain this enough without you attending yourself! It is located in the corner of a very grand apartment block, there is a doorman though so you can find it ok. Inside the decoration is plain, simple but extremely classy, very understated. The service is perfect (which is something you can often easily fault) but there were no faults. The food, there are 3 tasting menus to choose from - simply depends on how many courses you would like. For the amount of food you get the price is amazing value. You do not get a choice of the food, you simply get to taste every delight they offer you. We had 11 courses, every single course was fantastic. Mind blowing tastes with wonderful 'art' presentation. There are some very reasonable priced bottles of wine on the menu (something you don't often get in fine dining restaurants in the UK). I would highly recommend for any fine diners to book this whilst in Madrid. I will 100% go back whenever I next go to Madrid. Everything about the whole evening was 100% perfect.

I am so glad we were given a copy of the menu, it is a wonderful reminder of a special evening.

title_review: an exquisite meal and most gracious experience
review_preview: WOW.  WOW.  and WOW.our hotel recommended Club Allard for our 2nd night in Madrid, and we took that recommendation on face value without doing any further due diligence.  after a little difficulty in finding the restaurant (since it is on the 2nd floor of...
review_full: WOW. WOW. and WOW. our hotel recommended Club Allard for our 2nd night in Madrid, and we took that recommendation on face value without doing any further due diligence. after a little difficulty in finding the restaurant (since it is on the 2nd floor of what appears to be a grand apartment building on the corner of Plaza Espana), we were surprised to find that there was no a la carte, only tasting menus, something the hotel had not forewarned us about. feeling very badly, we offered to give up our table, because we didn't think we could eat the 9 courses on the smallest menu......the chef came out and very graciously offered instead to do a condensed menu instead, which we accepted. after the first few courses, in conversation with our very good server, we commented on how delicious everything was and how beautifully each course was prepared and presented. she responded by saying it was too bad we weren't doing the entire menu. now realizing how small each course was we lamented that we couldn't do the full menu and she offered to ask the chef if we could. the chef, once again, very graciously accommodated us! needless to say, all remaining courses were unbelievable! we travel extensively and this is one of the best restaurants, maybe even the best, that we've ever eaten at. obviously an expensive splurge, but well worth every eurocent!  thanks you Diego for your graciousness and your delicious food! and thank you too for your wonderful servers!

title_review: A Dinner to Remember in Madrid
review_preview: My husband and I had dinner at El Club Allard during a short stay in Madrid.  We knew we wanted to have one dinner that would be an exceptional experience, so I did some research about outstanding restaurants in Madrid.  I am so glad that...
review_full: My husband and I had dinner at El Club Allard during a short stay in Madrid. We knew we wanted to have one dinner that would be an exceptional experience, so I did some research about outstanding restaurants in Madrid. I am so glad that we chose El Club Allard. If you read the other reviews on TripAdvisor, you'll see that the food is sublime. What's clear is that the chef - Diego Guerrero - displays a real sense of humor in his presentation of the various courses. For example, one of our courses was a piece of camembert prepared to look like a small Babybel cheese. I could site other great examples, but don't want to ruin the experience for future diners! The service was also excellent, save for a slight mix-up at the beginning around which wait person would be serving us some additional wine. The wine suggestions made by the sommelier were excellent - a beautiful bottle of white which we drank with most of the courses, and then a gorgeous glass of red to accompany our meat course. Our only disappointment - and this is very minor and really an issue on our part - was that we often had difficulty understanding what the wait staff was saying as they described the ingredients of each course. They did speak English, which we appreciated greatly, but we missed some of the more unusual ingredients in each dish. At the end of our meal, the gentleman who took our order when we were first seated came to ask us how we enjoyed ourselves. Of course, we gushed about how we loved everything about the night and we asked that he express our gratitude to the chef. Weren't we so pleasantly surprised when he responded "I am the chef, so thank you!" We all laughed, shook hands, and my husband and I walked away as big fans of Diego Guerrero and El Club Allard. While a little more expensive than some other restaurants, the experience is worth every single euro.

review_preview: El Club Allard reminds me very much of a NYC dining experience. There is a very proper feel to the air as well as a strong sense of pride and professionalism. The environs are formal, spare, and spotless. Of all the places in which we...
review_full: El Club Allard reminds me very much of a NYC dining experience. There is a very proper feel to the air as well as a strong sense of pride and professionalism. The environs are formal, spare, and spotless. Of all the places in which we dined during our Madrid stay, El Club Allard felt the most like a dining spot for businessmen. The female chef in charge runs a very tight ship indeed. From the start, the gentleman serving us seemed to have a one-upmanship approach that rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe it was because we were American, or maybe it was just his persona, but that issue was settled after the third course. Even though El Club Allard had a stiff air to it, the food certainly met the rigorous standards one would expect of a dining destination of this caliber. The wine list is excellent, broad, and offers good value. At El Club Allard, you won‚Äôt find unusual experimentation, but you can rest assured, the dishes will reflect assiduous standards of preparation. It‚Äôs a serious dining affair

title_review: Superb choice of tasty food with attentive service
review_preview: My husband made a booking for a lunch through the restaurant's online system and immediately got confirmation, which took into account that I don't eat wheat. I have subsequently written to the restaurant to ask whether they could arrange a little happy birthday greeting for...
review_full: My husband made a booking for a lunch through the restaurant's online system and immediately got confirmation, which took into account that I don't eat wheat. I have subsequently written to the restaurant to ask whether they could arrange a little happy birthday greeting for my husband while serving deserts (inspired by the photos of previous visitors) and the reply was positive.  We arrived slightly before the booked time and were seated at the best table, overlooking the whole dining area. The 14-course menu presented a variety of food, and although I am a picky eater, I ate 12. Furthermore, when the staff saw that I was stalling with two courses, they immediately offered replacement. The freshly baked gluten-free bread was served to me at the start,while the offer of wheat-breads was diverse. This was the best gluten-free bread I ever tasted.  The recommendation for the wine was excellent and the chosen bottle wasn't pricey (compared to its shop value). At the time of the dessert, a big tray with small cakes and inscription in Swedish (using white chocolate) arrived, with a candle at the side, with recommendation it should be blown. Needless to say, my husband was speechless, while I almost cried from happiness.  After the meal, we were offered to see the kitchen, through a window partition and had opportunity to witness the head chef at work. We also received a parchment which had all courses printed in English. Beautiful experience, affordable (in some other places that would be the cost of meal at a one star restaurant).

review_preview: The best restaurants not only serve great food and deliver great service but they also manage to surprise you. El Club Allard is in this category.  There is also a personal touch, as the chef Diego Guerrero visited the table at the start to discuss...
review_full: The best restaurants not only serve great food and deliver great service but they also manage to surprise you. El Club Allard is in this category. There is also a personal touch, as the chef Diego Guerrero visited the table at the start to discuss allergies and preferences but also at the end and said goodbye as we left. There were three choices of tasting menu: Snacks (2 or 3 or 4), Appetizer (2 or 3 or 4) followed in each case by Fish, Meat, Pre-dessert and 2 Desserts. We went for the middle option but other tables which went for the shorter menu had different courses. We started with an amuse-bouche of candied salmon and caviar. All the snacks and appetizers were excellent, but the highlights for me were he Game truffle with Foie gras and the tasty Butterfish. The meat "Wagyu Picanha" was the best beef that I have had outside the USA. The pre-dessert and desserts all displayed great visual imagination - take a look at the "FIshbowl" and "Poached egg" desserts on the website! 11 courses plus amuse and petit fours sound a lot, but the portions are sized well and I felt replete (but not over-full) at the end. The service was good and helpful - they tried to answer (in English) the many questions relating to the ingredients. All in all, it was an excellent and memorable meal. Highly recommended.

review_full: Nestled near the Palco Real there could't be a finer spot to discover a royal dinning experience fit for a king and his queen. My partner found her "best pudding in her life" here. Course after course from the very reasonably priced 'menu degestation' did not disappoint once. This is unique gastronomic experience, with surprise and imagination firmly on the menu, is progressive, fresh and even at times amazing. The young chef finds time to visit each table and chat in an enthusiastic way - even after all his accolades and awards. His staff follow his lead and are knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Simply a must for those in the know.

title_review: A Delicious Taste of Laid Back Local Life
review_preview: I came across this on a TripAdvisor list of best restaurants in Madrid, and as it was relatively on my way from my lodging to the museum I was heading to that day, I made a point of stopping there for lunch. I was travelling...
review_full: I came across this on a TripAdvisor list of best restaurants in Madrid, and as it was relatively on my way from my lodging to the museum I was heading to that day, I made a point of stopping there for lunch. I was travelling solo but made to feel right at home by the lovely bartender who sat me by the window where I could take in the quiet, residential street. I gathered most of the patrons were locals and the decor exuded this fun mix of dark wood saloon atmosphere meets upscale dining. Several options of red, white and rose wine offered a fantastic way to round out the paella special, deliciously and easily accommodating my gluten free diet, all for a total bill of just under 13 euro. If I'd had more time in Madrid, I would have gone back for seconds.

title_review: Good but not a 2 michelin star experience
review_preview: We went for my graduation and as my parents had gone before and were absolutely blown away, I was really expecting something amazing. To be fair and give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt, we did arrive extremely late as the graduation ceremony dragged...
review_full: We went for my graduation and as my parents had gone before and were absolutely blown away, I was really expecting something amazing. To be fair and give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt, we did arrive extremely late as the graduation ceremony dragged on forever, and were probably the last ones to be seated. This having been said, that isn't really an excuse for the restaurant as we are paying a lot of money for this experience. We went with some friends who were visiting and they mostly shared our opinion. We got the 12 course menu and the food was very tasty, as was the wine selection. The only part that let me down was the desert. Overall the dining time was around 2-2:30 hours. While it was definitely a pleasant experience, unlike some other much more disappointing michelin star dinners I have had, I don't believe it was up to the standard of a 2 star michelin restaurant, and possibly not the price we payed either. The service was very good, although they weren't extremely accommodating with my sister who is a picky eater except for when the food had nuts that she's allergic to. I'm not dying to go back, though I might consider it to see if this was a one-time thing or if the restaurant has actually lost the 'wow' factor.

title_review: Unique Cuisine for any Open-minded Eater
review_preview: Nakeima is an exclusive restaurant to have a unique culinary experience. I dined here for dinner, and in this review, I will provide my insights. Typically, customers must wait outside before 8:00PM, on the conservative side, in order to guarantee a spot on the list...
review_full: Nakeima is an exclusive restaurant to have a unique culinary experience. I dined here for dinner, and in this review, I will provide my insights.  Typically, customers must wait outside before 8:00PM, on the conservative side, in order to guarantee a spot on the list at 8:30PM. They only let in the first 20 people. Once customers are on the list, they are free to leave and should be back at 9:00PM to grab their reserved seat.  Upon sitting down, I was greeted by name. The staff was very warm and made me feel welcomed. I encourage all customers dining here to be open-minded. There is no concrete menu. The team changes up what they prepare each night, and they ask which dishes you would like. Even with the language barrier, they communicated very well which ingredients are in all of their dishes. The gentleman sitting next to me was also very helpful. After placing my order, I watched the staff perform as a team. Everyone displayed pure talent. It was as if I was sitting in the front row witnessing a culinary show. While they were always busy, they remained calm and enthusiastic.  Dishes started coming out in repetition. The team members were very knowledgeable on which drinks complemented which dishes best. I took their advice, and I am glad I did. During my meal, I consumed ingredients which appeared exotic, yet every bite was completely euphoric. If you are adventurous with your food, or want to be, you must dine here. For many international people, trying things such as, pig ear or squid ink-infused double-fermented dough may seem too exotic. However, I encourage you to broaden your comfort zone and be optimistic. If something is too far-fetched for you, skip it. Everything about this place speaks talent. Trust the talent, and like me, you will be extremely pleased with your experience. While this restaurant is pricy, especially if you order multiple dishes and multiple drinks, I will certainly be back on special occasions with other open-minded eaters. If this review is at all helpful, please like it to increase its exposure. Thanks and have a pleasant experience.

They dont take bookings so you meed to go there at around 20,00 and queue few minutes until someone takes your name by order of arrival. You wouldnt imagine you will find this impressive restaurant in that location. Then you can go for a beer somewhere else to make time until 21,00 when you go in.  The atmosphere is great, with dark lights, cool music ( not too loud) and very friendly staff. You can seat at the bar or in one of the two tables they have. The cooks and waiters are behind the bar preparing everything and talking to customers As they told me i said to them to start bringin plates until i couldnt continue. And what an experience. Each dumplimg or piece of sushi was full of taste. So much that almost made me cry ! Like this we went through several rounds of delicious staff i cant describe. When i was almost full i asked what else they had and the cook said ... A bacon samdwich ! What? Well it was awesome, a thick slice of bacon cooked with i domt know what for about 5 days !!!!! Delicious Then they offered some nice desserts as well. We did a maridage of wines with the food, it was good but inwould not repeat it. We drunk a lot, it was expensive and not what i would have chosen. But the guys were really flexible, when something we didnt like they always tried to find aomething else for us. A superb experience and at good price ( except with the wine maridage)  Be careful and check in twitter as some days they close for events

review_preview: We're wraping up a two week visit to Spain.  Last night we returned to Malasana after a week in Nerja, and used trip advisor to find a restaurant nearby.  Dolores y Lola was a wonderful surprise.  This was the best meal we had in Spain,...
review_full: We're wraping up a two week visit to Spain. Last night we returned to Malasana after a week in Nerja, and used trip advisor to find a restaurant nearby.  Dolores y Lola was a wonderful surprise. This was the best meal we had in Spain, and we've had a number of excellent meals. The food is fresh and seasonal. The strawberry salad mentioned in other reviews was missing from the menu, replaced by a salad with chicken, mango, papaya and a lovely citrus infused oil dressing. The three of us shared the salad, chorizio, eggplant, meatballs, deserts and 2 rounds of sangria. Every dish was a delight on the tastebuds. The presentation of the food was simple and beautiful. I kept comparing the flavors to our visit to the Inn at Little Washington and Komi (places we visited with foodie friends, once each). The flavors were on par without, minus all the formalities For around $80‚Ç¨. The venue is small, tucked away and quiet. When we arrived at 8:45, the place was empty. It got busy after 9:00. We were the only tourists. It was fun watching two individuals who run the place, a female chef in the back and an all around conductor in the front.  The sangria was different, and the best we've had anywhere. The pitcher includes one full glass of wine, fresh fruit, and about 5 or six additional ingredients that we couldn't capture, maybe brandy, vodka, etc. Be careful, we finished two pitchers over 2 1/2 hour, I don't have a hangover, waiting for the others to wake up and see if they survived. I don't typically provide reviews, however, this place was special and deserves a call out. If we visit Madrid in the future, we'll return to this gem.

review_preview: We ate there on a Saturday, a group of six friends. It is not possible to reserve, you need to queue  outside and half an hour before they open they will give you a table. It's definitely worth the inconvenience. There are nigiris on the...
review_full: We ate there on a Saturday, a group of six friends. It is not possible to reserve, you need to queue outside and half an hour before they open they will give you a table. It's definitely worth the inconvenience. There are nigiris on the menu, some more traditional, some riskier, like the Iberian pork bacon one. All are delicious. The rest follows the same trend: a mix of Asian and Mediterranean (the Madrilenian calamari sandwich on chinese bread - fantastic, Thai curry with frog legs, oxtail dumplings, etc). We ended with two finger-licking deserts: a Japanese version of the traditional Spanish cheese-and-quince and roaste pinapple saut√©ed with black butter. Impeccable. Price is more than correct for the high quality of the menu, with a fast and polite service. If I had to name something that could improve it would be the loud music (just another of the many similarities with StreetXO) Highly recommended. We will definitely go back.

review_preview: At the moment, the reviews place this amongst the top restaurants in Madrid. I have to be honest, I found it average. The food was fresh, and the service was largely good - although there was a moment not when I asked if I could...
review_full: At the moment, the reviews place this amongst the top restaurants in Madrid. I have to be honest, I found it average. The food was fresh, and the service was largely good - although there was a moment not when I asked if I could have a table rather than eat at the bar - but the overall experience was very average. Plus sides, the kitchen is clean and the food comes quickly. Not so plus sides, the food is average and looks like many other tourist cafes, the kitchen is too small and the sauces come from jars and tubs. This is basically a pub, with an emphasis on the alcohol, with so-so food.

title_review: A hidden gem for food and local ambience
review_preview: It was recommended by known and unknown fellow adventures and after reading the menu and reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided go try it. As we walked through the Plaza de Mayor and the Mercado de San Miguel, it took all our efforts not to...
review_full: It was recommended by known and unknown fellow adventures and after reading the menu and reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided go try it. As we walked through the Plaza de Mayor and the Mercado de San Miguel, it took all our efforts not to devour every little snack that we saw there in order to be hungry enough to enjoy El Sur. The restaurant is in a narrow and somewhat hidden alley so it is definitely a "destination". It's small, a bar counter and a few tables visited mostly by locals. We found a table in the back almost immediately and over ordered as I always do, living up to my mantra of "The unexamined life is not worth living". We had the Patatas Bravas, Musaka, grilled Pulpo(octopus) and a shrimp risotto type dish paired with some Vermouth and Sangria. The food was very tasty and using extremely fresh ingredients. The atmosphere is very vibrant and the people, especially our servers, Johan and Carlos, very friendly and helpful! I can't recommend this taberna enough! It was quite reasonably priced with the Pulpo being the most expensive.

title_review: The most amazing meal and experience.
review_preview: We are seasoned foodies and regularly visit michelin restaurants around the UK and London and across the globe when on holiday. We picked this restaurant for its good reviews and location and it did not disappoint!. From the minute we entered the restaurant to the...
review_full: We are seasoned foodies and regularly visit michelin restaurants around the UK and London and across the globe when on holiday. We picked this restaurant for its good reviews and location and it did not disappoint!. From the minute we entered the restaurant to the time we finished and left, which was over 3 hours, the experience, food and service was exceptional and definitely warrants it's 2 michelin stars. We both had the 12 course menu, and I am a vegetarian. This was no problem at all for the restaurant and I can honestly say this was the best 12 courses I have ever had as vegetarian across all the michelin restaurants I have eaten in. Each course was magnificently presented and some of the tastes that were created were exceptional. One of our favourites being the cup-cake course. The wine we ordered was excellent as well. This was by far the best meal we had in Madrid, and if we ever travelled back we would definately visit again. Exceptional.

review_full: We celebrated my birthday at El Club Allard, and could not have had a better experience. We chose the "small" 10-course menu, and it was more than sufficient. The dishes were playful and inventive, but did not sacrifice taste for artfulness. Everything was delicious. The service was efficient and polite and at the same time very friendly--our sommelier was outstanding and selected a reasonably priced wine to accompany all our dishes. My only caveat would be that they should consider a wine pairing option to accompany the various dishes. Cannot recommend highly enough.
